statement.p: The ideal gas law can be expressed as \displaystyle{P}{V}={n}{R}{T} where \displaystyle{P} is pressure in atm (atmospheres), \displaystyle{V} is volume in liters, \displaystyle{n} is the number of moles (a count of molecules), \displaystyle{R} is a constant from physics, and \displaystyle{T} is the temperature (from absolute zero).
What is the pressure, in atmospheres, of 4.04 moles of a gas at a temperature of 406 K in a 21.7 liter container when R = 0.0821 (atmL)/(molK)?
